borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The scale and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of daylight to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020)</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div><br></div>

<div>The double storey side extension by reason of disruption to the roofscape is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies&nbsp;SP 2, DMD 1, DMD 4 and&nbsp;DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020)</span></div><div>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div><br></div>

<div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its excessive scale is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><br></div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies&nbsp;SP 2, DMD 1, DMD 4 and&nbsp;DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020)</span></div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div>
description: Construction of two storey side and rear extension.
